opened_prs.title: Add interop framework
opened_prs.body: Documenting some of the design choices that have come up, and giving them names so we can discuss and decide.

opened_prs.title: Feat: Create chain-specific addresses user stories
opened_prs.body:
This PR includes a document that outlines the expected user stories as a goal/reference for working towards chain-specific addresses.

Resolves https://github.com/ethereum/L2-interop/issues/21

opened_prs.title: docs: Introduce interop nomenclatures
opened_prs.body:
This PR introduces a set of definitions and common conventions that are relevant for the current interop tracks. All the feedback and suggestions are welcomed.

Address https://github.com/ethereum/L2-interop/issues/17

opened_prs.title: Docs: Atomic Swaps with Local Verification
opened_prs.body: Introduces a permissionless and trustless cross-chain asset transfer mechanism using Atomic Swaps, PreHTLCs, and local verification. This approach ensures fast settlement times without relying on cross-chain messaging protocols or third-party trust.

opened_prs.title: feat: add 7683 + intents framework discussion doc
opened_prs.body: Adding a discussion doc around the goals of the open intents framework and discussion around how generalizable 7683 is across impls.

opened_prs.title: Interoperable address spec
opened_prs.body:
I believe this is at a state where we can start a discussion. It is by no means final.

While resolver with id 3 is a good stopgap solution in my opinion, I believe we should iterate on this to:
- define another interface which uses CAIP-10 addresses in the short term, and a resolver using it
- define another resolver which resorts to something like ERC-7785 for chain identification in the longer term, to do away with the usage of centralized lists.

There are several lower-level items where I would greatly appreciate your ideas and feedback, see my own comments in the diff

opened_prs.title: docs: message-passing groups current goals and status
opened_prs.body: This PR adds a doc page formalizing the Message Passing Working Group goals and progress.  This will be the living doc the group references for all decisions made by the group.

opened_prs.title: Feat: add chain-specific addresses properties
opened_prs.body: This is the first PR that serves as a conversation starter to discuss properties for chain-specific addresses.

opened_issues.title: Finalize the ERC after iterative reviews and community consensus.
Develop a draft ERC for chain-specific addresses.
Create corresponding user stories based on the insights.
Digest findings and collect community feedback.
Gather and compare current efforts related to chain-specific addresses.
[Task] Chain-Specific Addresses
opened_issues.body:
## Overview
Track the full process for "Chain-Specific Addresses" from initial research to finalizing the ERC. This includes gathering and comparing current efforts, digesting feedback, creating user stories, and ultimately drafting and finalizing the ERC.

## Objectives
- [ ] #19 
- [ ] #20 
- [ ] #21 
- [ ] #22 
- [ ] #23 

## Details
- **Background:**  
  Chain-specific addresses are critical for interoperability. We need to consolidate existing efforts, analyze them, and ensure community feedback informs the requirements and user stories.
  
- **Requirements:**  
  - Research and compile current efforts on chain-specific addresses.
  - Organize a review session to digest findings and gather feedback.
  - Develop detailed user stories that capture the desired functionality and outcomes.
  - Draft an ERC based on these insights.
  - Iterate the draft ERC based on further feedback until a final version is agreed upon.

- **Acceptance Criteria:**  
  - Comprehensive documentation of current efforts and comparison is available.
  - Community feedback is documented and reflected in user stories.
  - A draft ERC is published for review.
  - A final ERC is approved and merged.

## Dependencies
- Coordination with team and community.
- Access to data and reports on current chain-specific address efforts.
- Review availability and proactive feedback loops.

## Additional Notes
- Ensure all documentation is maintained in the repository for transparency.
- Use standard templates and formats to ensure consistency.
- Regular updates and clear communication will be essential throughout this process.

wartime_milady_ceo_summary: - **Chain-Specific Addresses Initiative**: Several open issues (#18 to #23) are focused on developing an ERC for chain-specific addresses, emphasizing the need for interoperability. This includes gathering current efforts, digesting community feedback, and drafting and finalizing the ERC through iterative reviews.

- **Community Engagement and Feedback**: A structured process is outlined to ensure community feedback is integrated into the development of the ERC for chain-specific addresses. This involves organizing review sessions, documenting insights, and creating user stories that reflect community input.

- **Documentation and Transparency**: The initiative stresses the importance of maintaining comprehensive documentation and transparency throughout the process. This includes using standard templates, maintaining repository documentation, and ensuring regular updates and clear communication with the community.
